rules.text: Only multi-farm projects that centralize anaerobic manure treatment under the full applicability conditions qualify.
The central plant operator must retain farmer declarations assigning CER claims and provide them to the DOE.
Establish additionality using the approved tool for both the central facility and the participating farms.
Baseline scenario must remain anaerobic manure treatment without methane recovery.
Define the project boundary to include farm sites, transport, centralized treatment, biogas handling and energy systems.
Baseline methane emissions equal the sum of farm-level anaerobic system emissions.
Baseline fossil fuel and electricity emissions must rely on the approved combustion and electricity tools.
Project emissions cover residual methane, methane slip and auxiliary energy consumption.
Leakage covers incremental manure transport and any displaced baseline manure uses.
Monitor animal populations, manure flows, biogas production, methane content, COD removal, fossil fuel use and exported electricity/heat.
